Review Title: Best sales people should stay FAR away
Pros: Good place to start your career and learn about an important market.
Cons: Clueless sales leadership. Weak comp plans, quotas are ridiculously high which explains why so few hit their numbers. Good reps quickly figure out that it's impossible to make money and leave for better places. HR is total joke and will waste a huge chunks of time with their silly training.

Pros: sales pipeline is solid with lots of offerings
Cons: management is elusive and unapproachable

Pros: Fabulous Work Environment, Awesome work. Great Talented Team, Inspiring Managers. I loved the3 years I spent here, but was a consultant for a limited time.

Pros: Great culture the company retained a culture of small collaborative groups.

Pros:
Flexible work schedule
Growth
Learning opportunities
Independence in role
Cons:
Great company overall, few cons would be the turnover rate is high in this company. In my team alone of about 30 people, within this year,  we lost about 5+ members not to mention the turnover rate amongst senior leaders throughout the company.

Salary is decent, but they could do better with yearly raises and bonuses. They always promote how well the company is doing, but it isn’t reflected in the raises or bonuses.

Another con would be the constant changes and lack of stability that comes with it. I’ve started under TR, then it became Refinitiv and now it’s LSEG. Too many rebrands and re-orgs which is draining.

Lastly,  is a personal preference, but I don’t like how woke this company is. Very left-wing and politicized agendas are brought up often in town-halls. I don’t care about race, gender or religion constantly being pushed in the workplace. The diversity efforts is very forced and uncomfortable. All I care about if you’re a hardworking individual who is capable of doing the job. I don’t know why all the other stuff matters.

Pros: People, Sales Managers, and Location
Cons: High quotas, specialist responsibilities are blurred, most people are coasting

Pros: Pay slightly above average and great colleagues.
Cons: Cycled through GTM management team every few years, repeating the same mistakes.

Pros: Great products and client relationships
Cons: Management does not trust employees and have too many internal hurdles to prove themselves.

Review Title: People of color are not valued and not promoted
Pros: Vacation time for new hires was generous at 3 weeks. And schedules were flexible.
Cons: There were no process in place to help facilitate professional growth. If an employee was favored by upper management that employee was promoted regardless of having the skill set to perform the responsibilities needed for the role. It was an environment of friends promoting friends. There was also a huge amount of nepotism within the organization. From my perspective there was discrimination within the company. If you were a person of color and did not play "the game" there were no opportunities for growth. You were completely overlooked and dismissed.

Review Title: If you want revenge, refer that person to LSEG/Refinitiv
Pros: You can always leave their employ.
Cons:
The only people staying are those hoping for a contract buyout or severance package. This means demotivated, overworked people who know the ship is sinking and are hoping for a life preserver.

The Refinitiv management group really did a fast one on LSEG. Given all the audits and hoops the general workers had to go through, it is amazing LSEG couldn't see the con.

They do a great job of talking up diversity and work-life balance. Just don't belong to a "non-protected" group or ask for time off.
